User provide high-level research directi.Example: Design an AI model to predict Absorption (one of the ADMET properties) using the PAMPA dataset.
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Defines the objective for the LLM Planner and Instructor agents.

User provide datasets other than researc.Format: Starter files, e.g., CSV datasets for PAMPA, DAVIS, HIV
User provide datasets other than researc.Example: train.csv, val.csv, test.csv for each task
User provide datasets other than researc.Role in workflow: Provides the data for model training, validation, and testing.

User provide representations or formal i.Format: SMILES strings for molecules, amino acid sequences for proteins
User provide representations or formal i.Example: Drug column with SMILES, Protein column with sequence in CSV files
User provide representations or formal i.Role in workflow: Serves as input features for featurization and modeling.

Structural or Entity Decomposition.Method details: Featurization of molecules and proteins using fingerprints, graph-based, and one-hot encoding methods.
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Outputs: Feature vectors for drugs and proteins
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Example: ECFP4 fingerprint for drugs, CT encoding for proteins
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Role in workflow: Enables downstream ML models to process biological entities.

Workflow Decomposition.Method details: LLM Planner splits the task into multiple solution ideas and substeps, iteratively refined by the Instructor.
Workflow Decomposition.Outputs: Set of candidate solution ideas and substeps
Workflow Decomposition.Example: Planner generates ideas: LR (one-hot), GNN, Random Forest (fingerprinting), DNN, etc.
Workflow Decomposition.Role in workflow: Structures the exploration of solution space and guides implementation.

Molecular or Chemical Embedding.Method details: Drug featurization using ECFP4 fingerprints and other molecular descriptors.
Molecular or Chemical Embedding.Role in workflow: Transforms chemical structures into ML-ready features.

Biological or Phenotypic Embedding.Method details: Protein featurization using CT encoding and other fingerprinting methods.
Biological or Phenotypic Embedding.Role in workflow: Enables ML models to process protein sequence information.

Pattern and Feature Extraction.Method details: Extraction of features from datasets via domain-specific featurizers for drugs and proteins.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Example: Concatenation of drug and protein features for Random Forest input
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Role in workflow: Provides empirical input for model training and evaluation.

Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Method details: Protein sequence features extracted via fingerprinting and one-hot encoding.
Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Example: One-hot encoding or CT fingerprint for protein
Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Role in workflow: Enables ML models to utilize sequence-level information.

Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Method details: LLM Planner generates multiple solution ideas, each potentially requiring different data preprocessing or retrieval.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Outputs: Candidate solution ideas with associated data requirements
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Example: Planner considers GNN (needs graph data), Random Forest (needs fingerprints), etc.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Role in workflow: Ensures diverse data representations are explored.

Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Method details: Instructor agent uses domain-specific documentation and tools (TDC, RDKit, DGL-LifeSci, PyBioMed) to retrieve and preprocess data.
Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Example: Downloading and splitting data using TDC library
Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Role in workflow: Ensures correct handling of biological data for ML tasks.

Code-Driven or Tool-Augmented Data Retri.Method details: Agents generate and execute code to load, preprocess, and featurize datasets.
Code-Driven or Tool-Augmented Data Retri.Example: Python code to load CSVs and apply featurizers
Code-Driven or Tool-Augmented Data Retri.Role in workflow: Automates data preparation for downstream ML.

Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Method details: Datasets are accessed and split using TDC library functions.
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Example: TDC random split strategy for PAMPA and HIV datasets
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Role in workflow: Provides standardized data splits for benchmarking.

Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Method details: LLM Planner generates solution ideas using internal knowledge and task description.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Outputs: Set of candidate solution ideas (e.g., model types, featurization strategies)
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Example: Planner proposes LR (one-hot), GNN, Random Forest (fingerprinting), DNN, etc.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Role in workflow: Initiates exploration of solution space for the drug discovery task.

LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Method details: Planner agent decomposes the task into multiple solution strategies and substeps.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Example: Planner generates and explores multiple modeling approaches in parallel.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Role in workflow: Enables systematic exploration and comparison of diverse approaches.

Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Method details: Instructor agent integrates domain-specific documentation and tools to generate feasible implementations.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Example: Instructor selects appropriate featurization and modeling tools for drug/protein data.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Role in workflow: Ensures generated ideas are grounded in domain best practices.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: Instructor agent evaluates feasibility and correctness of ideas using domain knowledge and documentation.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: Instructor rejects graph-based protein encoding as infeasible for 1D sequences.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Filters out unworkable or suboptimal approaches before implementation.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: Ideas are evaluated based on empirical performance (e.g., ROC-AUC on validation set).
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: Validation ROC-AUC = 0.922 for Random Forest approach.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Guides selection of the best-performing solution for final submission.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Method details: Performance metrics such as ROC-AUC are used to quantitatively assess and compare ideas.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Example: Average ROC-AUC reported for each method across datasets.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: Planner and Instructor agents collaboratively generate, refine, and implement experimental code for ML pipelines.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Outputs: Executable code for model training, validation, and testing
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Agents generate Python scripts for Random Forest training and evaluation.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Role in workflow: Automates the design and execution of ML experiments.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: Agents translate solution ideas into executable scripts, including data loading, featurization, model training, and prediction.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Outputs: Python code implementing the ML workflow
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Sample code for Random Forest with ECFP4 and CT features.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Role in workflow: Bridges high-level ideas and concrete experimental execution.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: Planner generates ideas; Instructor implements and tests them, reporting back for iterative refinement.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Planner-Instructor loop for exploring and selecting optimal approaches.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Role in workflow: Enables division of labor and iterative improvement.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: Instructor maps solution ideas to domain-specific tools and featurizers (e.g., ECFP4, CT, ChemBERTa, ESM).
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Selecting ECFP4 for drug and CT for protein encoding.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Role in workflow: Ensures experimental design is tailored to biomedical context.

Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Method details: Generated code is executed to train and evaluate ML models on provided datasets.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Example: Random Forest model trained and evaluated on DAVIS dataset.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Role in workflow: Validates solution ideas through computational experiments.

Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Method details: Planner and Instructor iteratively update idea space and implementation based on test outcomes and failure reports.
Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Example: Planner discards infeasible ideas after Instructor reports failure.
Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Role in workflow: Improves solution quality through iterative feedback.

Refinement via Dynamic Agent Updating Ba.Method details: Planner updates idea set in response to observed failures or successes during execution.
Refinement via Dynamic Agent Updating Ba.Example: Skipping graph-based methods after failed protein graph encoding.
Refinement via Dynamic Agent Updating Ba.Role in workflow: Adapts exploration based on empirical feedback.

Refinement via guided by computational-d.Method details: Refinement decisions are based on validation/test performance metrics (e.g., ROC-AUC).
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Example: Choosing Random Forest over Logistic Regression based on higher ROC-AUC.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Role in workflow: Ensures only empirically validated solutions are advanced.

Refinement via Performance-metric.Method details: Performance on validation/test sets (e.g., ROC-AUC) guides refinement and final selection.
Refinement via Performance-metric.Example: Selecting top-3 solutions based on validation ROC-AUC.
Refinement via Performance-metric.Role in workflow: Directs iterative improvement and final submission.

paper_title: DrugAgent: Automating AI-aided Drug Discovery Programming through LLM Multi-Agent Collaboration
